Tucson is now able to roll on his own tires, yet, to concerve what energy h=
e has left, he keeps his speed at a reasonable clip, to avoid burning more =
energy than he needs to.  He was glad to have the company of Talon, Kup and=
 Windlord, and knew that if anyone could help him not circumb to his weakne=
ss, they could.  He knew it well.  It was his short temper.  Yet, he did no=
t know how he would react upon finding out who the intruder was who had sab=
otaged the Ark, putting everyone he cared about in grave danger.  He was st=
ill angry inside.  To him it was a desicration of sacred ground and to dish=
onor Primus as the intruder had done, was an unspeakable act in Tucson's di=
rectory.  He knew he would not spare the enemy any mercy.  Yet he did not w=
ant to come across as another Galvatron.  He thinks things through while on=
 the way back to the Ark.  How to get his point across without stooping to =
the level of a Decepticon leader?

"Thank you for your company, Kup, everyo=
ne. I do appreciate your concern."

He sighs.

" I sense an intruder has do=
ne an unspeakable act at the Ark.  Taken it as if sacred ground was theirs =
to take.  Words can't describe how infurating that is to me.  The Ark is ou=
r home, our refuge, and to corrupt the Ark as it is being corrupted is an a=
ct against Primus himself.  I have to see that this intruder is dealt with =
appropriately, yet to me they deserve no mercy.  I know that if I let my te=
mper get the best of me, I'll do something I'll regret.  I will be no bette=
r than Galvatron himself, in his days.  I do not wish to become as such."

=
Rat Trap monitors Tucson's energy levels from inside the cab.  He then look=
s to Talon and Straight Shot.

" So far, okay.  Not wonderful, but he'll ma=
ke it home.  Anyway, I'd like nothn' more than ta see that intruder get wha=
t's comm'n ta him. "

Straight Shot interjects.

"Yes, but at the same time=
, he doesn't wanna stoop to Galvatrons' level.  It's a complicated situatio=
n Rat Trap.  We all know what happens when Tucson loses his temper, at leas=
t, Night Shift and I know.  We've seen it happen."

Night Shift drives up w=
ith Kup.

"Ohh yeah, believe us Rat Trap, the big guy here, he's capable of=
 don' a lotta damage. And I dunno if he wants ta do that this time."

Rat T=
rap nodds.

"Hmm, good point, wouldn't make anyone look good would it?"

Tu=
cson replies.

"I'm afraid not Rat Trap.  This time, I know I'll need Rodim=
us's imput on how to deal with the intruder.  It's the best way to come to =
a resolve."

Straight Shot nodds.

" I like that idea.  I like it alot.  Th=
at's what being an Autobot is all about.  Consult with each other, and find=
 the best possible way to deal with a situation without stooping to the lev=
el of a Decepticon leader."

Tucson continues.

"Yes. But I also would like=
 the imput of everyone else as well.  As soon as we regain control of the A=
rk, and have the enemy immobilized, we should hold a meeting and see what k=
ind of suggestions everyone has.  Perhaps we can merge ideas and deal with =
this enemy in an apropriate manner."

He makes another contact to Rodimus.
=

" Rodimus, as soon as we can regain control of the Ark, and the enemy is s=
ubdued, I'd like everyone to meet in the control room, so we can figure out=
 how to deal with the intruder in an apropriate manner.  I'd like everyone'=
s imput as how to go about it.  After all, he just didn't anger me, he ange=
red and endangered everyone. "

 You're just gonna get yourself even more damaged than ya already are."

we don't always win the

ys save the day, Tucson.  You've

ry moment I take to

.  No, I will not rest until this

 groans.
>

r fight,

ect of his emotional state.
>

o be done regardless of my

u your freedom and your saftey.

 gets upset.

cent of your power!  You 
> got nothn' left!  You try ta fight now you coul=
d go off line permanently! 
> YOUR LIFE IS DEPENDING ON IT!"
>

Shot sits up.

to temporarilly take

aving your aft! Now 
> Rodimus doesn't want you to risk your life, and neit=
her does anyone else! 
> For once, LISTEN TO US!"
> 
> Tucson pauses.
> 
> =
" Bantor, I - need you to go ahead to back up the other Fuzors, and to see =

> if Rodimus needs your help.  I can now drive myself with the energy I've=
 got 
> left.  I will arrive at the Ark shortly following your arrival ther=
e. 
> Primus be with you."
> 
> Everyone heaves a sigh of releif. Especiall=
y Rat Trap.
> 
> "Good choice.  So, what next Wheels?"
> 
> Tucson replies =
as he warms up his engine to continue on his own wheels.
> 
> " It seems th=
at whoever has taken control of the Ark, has tampered with it's 
> configur=
ation, via the mainframe.  There is only one thing that could 
> possibly i=
nterrupt that.  My sonar system.  It has the ability to disrupt 
> most ali=
en programming, and perhaps with enough of a disruption, we may - 
> just b=
e able to gain control of it again."
> 
> Rat Trap grins.
> 
> "Heeeeey, th=
at's right, that'll create a weankess in the programming and 
> that's when=
 we can take advantage of reclaiming the configurations.  Better 
> get bac=
k ta Rodimus and the others about that."
> 
> Tucson acknolwedges and conta=
cts Rodimus.

ose enough to the 
> ark, I am going to attempt a short range sonar disrupt=
ion intercept of the 
> Ark's systems.  Hopefully this will cause enough of=
 a falter, for us to 
> regain control of the system via an interruption of=
 frequencies.  Tell - 
> Legacy to be ready to intercept the mainframe on m=
y mark.  Tucson Prime 
> out."
> 
> Straight Shot smiles.
> 
> "Now that's =
the Tucson Prime I know.  Resourceful yet sensible.  Just like a 
> truck s=
hould be."
